issue.title: Desktop: Fixes #6813: Upgrade electron to 19.0.10
issue.body:
Fixes #6813 

Under Asahi Linux I tried Joplin with a few different electron versions with these results
- 18.2.0 ❌ 
- 18.3.2 ❌ 
- 18.3.6 ❌ 
- 19.0.0 ✅ 
- 19.0.10 ✅ 

So it looks like the fix was introduced in 19.0.0 (since there were no releases between 18.3.6 and 19.0.0) but I set the version to 19.0.10 to take advantage of any bug fixes on the minor releases.

comment.body:
@laurent22 I've tested the following

- [x] printing
- [x] export (tried with pdf and html)
- [x] file attachment (tried with an image)
- [x] plugins (I tried bulk note plugin)
- [x] sync (with dropbox)
- [x] external editing

commits.message: Desktop: Fixes #6257: Fixed the missing format when pasting text by Ctrl+V in Rich Text editor (#6901)

issue.title: Desktop: Fixes #6813: Upgrade electron to 19.0.10
issue.body:
Fixes #6813 

Under Asahi Linux I tried Joplin with a few different electron versions with these results
- 18.2.0 ❌ 
- 18.3.2 ❌ 
- 18.3.6 ❌ 
- 19.0.0 ✅ 
- 19.0.10 ✅ 

So it looks like the fix was introduced in 19.0.0 (since there were no releases between 18.3.6 and 19.0.0) but I set the version to 19.0.10 to take advantage of any bug fixes on the minor releases.

comment.body:
@laurent22 Good point. I've been using it for a few days but not really putting it through it's paces so I'll do that. In the meantime, I did just take a look at [breaking changes](https://www.electronjs.org/blog/electron-19-0#breaking--api-changes) in the release notes and couldn't find any places in the code that would be affected by them

> Unsupported on Linux: .skipTaskbar
> The BrowserWindow constructor option skipTaskbar is no longer supported on Linux. Changed in [#33226](https://github.com/electron/electron/pull/33226)

> Removed WebPreferences.preloadURL
> The semi-documented preloadURL property has been removed from WebPreferences. [#33228](https://github.com/electron/electron/pull/33228). WebPreferences.preload should be used instead.

issue.title: Enable aarch64 architecture
issue.body: Can you enable the `aarch64` architecture for `mpir`? I'm using it successfully in Asahi Linux with the `meshlab` application

comment.body: My pleasure! Thanks for the swift response 👍🏼

issue.title: Linux arm64 Support
issue.body:
I am using Postman on an arm64 Chromebook, running Linux using the Crouton method.  The Chrome app works, but there isn't a native version for arm64 linux.  Would you please consider making an arm64 linux native version before you completely kill the Chrome version?

Thank you for your consideration.

comment.body:
> The good news first: we have a preview build we can share today: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Ufvpra2td1ViKZf0PKz4AN_BrGheRTRa/view?usp=sharing

Holy cow, that's a big file! I can confirm it is not working in Asahi (just segfaults), I assume due to the whole page size shenanigans?

pull_request.title: Enable aarch64 architecture
pull_request.body: Can you enable the `aarch64` architecture for `mpir`? I'm using it successfully in Asahi Linux with the `meshlab` application

issue.title: Update electron to have the fix for kernel page size on linux so it can ran on Asahi linux without the need of a 4k kernel
issue.body:
Install Joplin on Asahi linux (Macbook Air M1 2020)
you can run it only if you have a 4k kernel due to not updated electron 

## Environment

Joplin version: 2.8.8
Platform: Linux
OS specifics: Asahi Linux

comment.body:
@cmalvi Do you mean the official builds made by github actions? Yeah, I didn't change those, but when you build locally in Asahi you get an arm64 AppImage
```
> yarn workspace @joplin/app-desktop run electron-builder build --linux                                                                                                
  • electron-builder  version=23.0.8 os=5.19.0-asahi-5-1-ARCH
  • loaded configuration  file=package.json ("build" field)
  • electron-rebuild not required if you use electron-builder, please consider to remove excess dependency from devDependencies

To ensure your native dependencies are always matched electron version, simply add script `"postinstall": "electron-builder install-app-deps" to your `package.json`
  • writing effective config  file=dist/builder-effective-config.yaml
  • skipped dependencies rebuild  reason=npmRebuild is set to false
  • packaging       platform=linux arch=arm64 electron=19.0.10 appOutDir=dist/linux-arm64-unpacked
  • building        target=AppImage arch=arm64 file=dist/Joplin-2.9.8-arm64.AppImage
  ```

issue.title: Update electron to have the fix for kernel page size on linux so it can ran on Asahi linux without the need of a 4k kernel
issue.body:
Install Joplin on Asahi linux (Macbook Air M1 2020)
you can run it only if you have a 4k kernel due to not updated electron 

## Environment

Joplin version: 2.8.8
Platform: Linux
OS specifics: Asahi Linux

comment.body: @cmalvi I think so. If you do a build with this change, you should get a working AppImage

issue.title: Update electron to have the fix for kernel page size on linux so it can ran on Asahi linux without the need of a 4k kernel
issue.body:
Install Joplin on Asahi linux (Macbook Air M1 2020)
you can run it only if you have a 4k kernel due to not updated electron 

## Environment

Joplin version: 2.8.8
Platform: Linux
OS specifics: Asahi Linux

comment.body: @cmalvi #6888 fixes this. [Here](https://github.com/alfredopalhares/arch-pkgbuilds/pull/117) is a PR to fix the `PKGBUILD` in the AUR

pull_request.title: Joplin Desktop: Support arm64 and Asahi Linux
pull_request.body:
Only small changes are needed to support ARM64, including Asahi Linux
- Add aarch64 to supported arches
- Add an * to the `dist` directory because the directory is `dist/linux-arm64-unpacked` when built on an arm64 machine
- Upgrade Electron to 19.0.10. This change is needed for Asahi Linux due to the kernel [only supporting 16k page sizes](https://asahilinux.org/2022/03/asahi-linux-alpha-release/). Electron < 19.0.0 just crashes on start up in Asahi Linux. Since this change is not needed for all ARM64 devices I'm happy to move it to a different PR if you'd like. Here is the [upstream PR](https://github.com/laurent22/joplin/pull/6888) to upgrade Electron in Joplin desktop.

pull_request.title: Desktop: Fixes #6813: Upgrade electron to 19.0.10
pull_request.body:
Under Asahi Linux I tried Joplin with a few different electron versions with these results
- 18.2.0 ❌ 
- 18.3.2 ❌ 
- 18.3.6 ❌ 
- 19.0.0 ✅ 
- 19.0.10 ✅ 

So it looks like the fix was introduced in 19.0.0 (since there were no releases between 18.3.6 and 19.0.0) but I set the version to 19.0.10 to take advantage of any bug fixes on the minor releases.

issue.title: Link Mode Troubleshooting
issue.body: If you want to spend time troubleshooting the link mode functionality, here is the place. I can provide more insight how it works (if I still remember) and maybe we figure out together what's wrong. Maybe it works, maybe not... after all it is still beta.

comment.body: Link mode is working great for me, thanks for this!

- 19.0.0 ✅ 
- 19.0.10 ✅ 

So it looks like the fix was introduced in 19.0.0 (since there were no releases between 18.3.6 and 19.0.0) but I set the version to 19.0.10 to take advantage of any bug fixes on the minor releases.

issue.title: Link Mode Troubleshooting
issue.body: If you want to spend time troubleshooting the link mode functionality, here is the place. I can provide more insight how it works (if I still remember) and maybe we figure out together what's wrong. Maybe it works, maybe not... after all it is still beta.

comment.body: Link mode is working great for me, thanks for this!
